Answer_2: To open the back-pressure regulating valve when evaporator  coil pressure increases.
Answer_3: To direct evaporator outlet pressure to the lower part of the solenoid bellows.

Question_Title: Chromium is a nobler metal when compared to that of steel. In some marine applications Chromium is electroplated to the steel surfaces. Why?

Question_Title: As the percentage of CO2 in the stack gas decreases, you can assume that __________.
Answer_1: the fuel to air ratio is increasing
Answer_2: fuel is being burned with increasing economy

Question_Title: The valve located between the fuel oil header and the burner valve is known as the __________.
The end product of reactions occurring when boiler water is chemically treated, remain in the boiler and increase the need for __________.
Why is superheated steam used in the main propulsion turbines instead of saturated steam?
Answer_1: Less specific energy available per pound of steam.
Answer_2: Greater heat energy available per pound of steam.
Answer_3: Higher pressure available than saturated steam.
Answer_4: Lower required specific volume than saturated steam.

Question_Title: Reduction gear bearing bridge gage readings should be taken after __________.
Answer_1: rotating the journal to the point of minimum oil clearance
Answer_2: all bearing caps and all bearing halves are removed
Answer_3: rotating the bearing shell so that the point of maximum bearing wear is directly at the bottom
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: The purpose of the mica used in a boiler water gage glass assembly is to prevent __________.
When the flame scanner senses flame failure during boiler operation, which of the listed events will occur FIRST?
Answer_1: The fuel oil service pump is stopped.
Answer_3: The fuel oil solenoid valve is de-energized.

Question_Title: Improper boiler feedwater deaeration could be directly linked to __________.
Answer_2: fluctuating deaerating feed tank level as a result of taking on makeup feed too rapidly
Answer_3: fluctuating condensate pressure due to not maintaining proper hotwell level

Question_Title: In a closed feedwater system, the greatest deaeration of condensate occurs in the __________.
Most marine boilers are designed to produce __________.
Excessive combustion air in a boiler is indicated by the flame ends appearing as a/an __________.
Fuel oil atomizers are used in boilers to __________.
Answer_1: control the temperature of fuel entering the furnace
Answer_2: control the amount of air entering the furnace
Answer_4: break fuel oil into a fine spray

Question_Title: A continuous blow is used to __________.
Answer_1: regulate the density or salinity of boiler water
Answer_2: remove scum from the surface of boiler water
Answer_3: permit air to escape while raising steam in a cold boiler
Answer_4: remove sludge from the bottom of the water drum

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct regarding axial thrust in a high pressure velocity-compounded turbine?
Answer_1: Most of the thrust produced is counter balanced by the action of a dummy piston.
Answer_2: Only a small portion of the thrust produced is counter balanced by the action of a dummy piston.
Answer_3: The thrust is minimized by equalizing holes drilled in the  turbine wheels.
Answer_4: The thrust is transmitted to and absorbed by the high speed pinion and gear.

Question_Title: Where is the 'dry pipe' located in a boiler?
Answer_3: In the top of the steam drum

Question_Title: The weight of saturated steam is a factor dependent upon its __________.
The pressure in the feedwater system must exceed boiler steam drum pressure in order to __________.
Answer_1: prevent water hammer in the lines
Answer_2: prevent air leakage into the feedwater system
Answer_3: force the feedwater into the boiler
Answer_4: remove the steam from the steam drum

Question_Title: Feedwater is deaerated to prevent __________.
Steam line water hammer can be best prevented by __________.
Answer_4: keeping steam temperature below the saturation point

Question_Title: White smoke coming from the stack of a main propulsion boiler indicates __________.
Answer_2: partially burned fuel particles are leaving the stack
Answer_3: excessive air velocity through the air registers

Question_Title: In a marine boiler equipped with mechanically atomized burner assemblies, proper combustion depends on the __________.
Answer_1: design and mechanical construction of the atomizers
Answer_2: speed of the forced draft fan and quantity of excess air
Answer_3: centrifugal force imparted to the oil in the atomizer

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the use of hydrazine in boiler water treatment?
Answer_1: A reserve is maintained by continually adding it to the feedwater rather than the boiler water.
Answer_2: It removes free oxygen from the boiler without increasing total dissolved solid content.
Answer_3: It aids in maintaining the pH of the boiler water within the prescribed limits.

Question_Title: The photoelectric cell installed as part of the combustion  safety controls of an automatically fired boiler will __________.
Answer_1: sense light from the burner flame
Answer_2: control the modulating pressure control circuit
Answer_3: open the control circuit upon sensing an intense flame
Answer_4: close the control circuit upon sensing a flame failure

Question_Title: Steam passing through a multistage impulse turbine does not impart any appreciable axial thrust to the rotor.  This is  primarily due to the __________.
Answer_1: pressure drop taking place in the nozzles
Answer_3: equalizing holes provided in the turbine wheel
Answer_4: steam passing through the blades only once with the largest pressure drop taking place in the first-stage

Question_Title: The glass used in a flat-type boiler water gage is protected from the hot steam and water by a/an __________.
In a given weight of steam, four-fifths is vapor and one-fifth is moisture.  The steam in this mixture is best described as __________.
Increasing the temperature of the feedwater entering the steam drum will ultimately result in a/an __________.
Answer_3: decrease in the degree of superheat
Answer_4: decrease in the quality of steam entering the superheater

Question_Title: Condensate is pumped from the condenser to the DC heater instead of directly to the boiler because __________.
Answer_1: boiler feed pumps must operate with a negative suction head
Answer_2: suspended solids in the condensate must be eliminated
Answer_3: condensate should be deaerated before entering the boiler
Answer_4: condensate at condensing temperature is too hot and will cause thermal stress in the boiler

Question_Title: In what section of a boiler would you find a steam quality of 90%?
Increased dry gas loss and reduced boiler efficiency result from carrying too much excess air because excess air __________.
Answer_1: varies with the degree of deposits on heat absorbing surfaces
Answer_2: increases the amount of stack gas weight and temperature
Answer_3: effects the amount of volatile matter and ash content of the fuel
Answer_4: reduces the amount of harmful impurities produced by burning residual fuel

Question_Title: Fuel oil viscosity to the atomizer can be reduced by __________.
Answer_1: increasing the fuel oil heater steam supply
Answer_2: mixing heavier oil with the fuel

Question_Title: The atmospheric drain tank is normally evacuated by __________.
Answer_1: vacuum drag to the main and/or auxiliary condenser
Answer_3: vacuum drag to the main and/or auxiliary air ejector condenser

Question_Title: A flame scanner installed in modern boiler combustion control systems, functions to __________.
Answer_1: cut off the fuel supply when the fires go out
Answer_2: monitor the stack for soot fires

Question_Title: To minimize axial thrust in an impulse turbine, equalizing  holes are located __________.
Answer_1: between the steam inlet and the front of the dummy piston
Answer_2: between the exhaust outlet and the front of the dummy piston

Question_Title: If the low water level alarm sounds on an automatically fired boiler, and the low water cutout fails to function, you must immediately __________.
Answer_1: blowdown the gage glass to determine where the water level  is
Answer_2: increase the feedwater supply to maintain the water level
Answer_3: start the emergency feedwater injector to restore the normal water level
Answer_4: secure the fires to minimize damage to the boiler tubes

Question_Title: Combustion control systems on automatic boilers are designed to prevent immediate burner ignition after a normal or safety shutdown in order to allow time for __________.
Answer_2: electric charge buildup in the igniter

Question_Title: When it is necessary to operate a turbine driven main feed  pump at shut off head, or at 20% or less of its rated capacity, what will prevent the pump from overheating?
Answer_1: Throttling of the steam supply valve.
Answer_2: Throttling of the liquid discharge valve.
Answer_3: A bypass or recirculating line led back to the pump impeller eye or suction.
Answer_4: A bypass or recirculating line led back to the source of suction supply.

Question_Title: Discharging an excessive amount of cold water into the DC heater during normal steaming conditions could cause __________.
Answer_1: flashing at the feed pump suction

Question_Title: The turndown ratio an automatic combustion control system is the ratio __________.
Answer_1: of air to fuel for a given firing rate
Answer_2: of forced draft fan speed to feedwater flow
Answer_3: between the highest and lowest oil pressure at which the burner will remain lit
Answer_4: between fuel oil pressure and atomizing steam pressure at a given firing rate

Question_Title: In a properly designed boiler, which of the end points should be reached first?
To obtain the best mixing of air and fuel with a fuel oil atomizer, you need to adjust the __________.
Answer_1: atomizer position using the distance piece
Answer_3: primary and secondary air cones for desired air flow
Answer_4: total air volume admitted to the boiler furnace

Question_Title: Dissolved oxygen can be removed from the boiler water by __________.
Answer_2: dumping and refilling the boiler weekly
Answer_3: passing the water through absorbent filters
Answer_4: treating the water with chemical scavengers

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning a photocell flame scanning system?
Answer_1: The photocell requires a large amount of voltage.
Answer_2: The scanner head must be adjusted to sight the sensitivity  link.
Answer_3: The scanner works in conjunction with the burner fuel oil (solenoid controlled) shut off valves.
Answer_4: The scanner window must be isolated from the forced draft fan air.

Question_Title: When a turbine is in operation, a rotor position micrometer is used to determine any change in rotor __________.
Answer_1: radial position relative to the casing
Answer_2: radial position relative to the micrometer
Answer_3: axial position relative to the casing
Answer_4: axial position relative to the micrometer

Question_Title: How is the nozzle in a nozzle reaction safety valve held in place?
If the control air pressure for an automatic combustion control system is lost during maneuvering, you should immediately __________.
Answer_3: attempt to restart the air compressor

Question_Title: A turbine-driven centrifugal feed pump used for boiler feed service should normally be stopped by __________.
Answer_2: closing off the steam via the excess pressure pump governor
Answer_4: opening wide the recirculating valve and then manually closing the throttle

Question_Title: To provide emergency feedwater supply to a steaming boiler  if it becomes necessary to secure the DC heater, suction should be taken on the distilled water tank using the __________.
In addition to monitoring flame quality, flame scanners are used in combustion control systems to __________.
Answer_1: regulate the air/fuel ratio controller for more efficient combustion
Answer_2: secure the forced draft fans upon flame failure
Answer_3: automatically open the fuel oil solenoid valves
Answer_4: secure the fuel supply in the event of a flame failure

Question_Title: In a properly designed boiler, which end point is most likely to occur first?
Fuel oil passing through the burners is divided into fine particles by the __________.
Although accurate tests of boiler water for dissolved oxygen are difficult to obtain on board ship, you can be fairly certain of proper oxygen removal by __________.
Answer_1: testing frequently for total dissolved solids
Answer_3: giving the boiler frequent surface blows
Answer_4: testing boiler water for excess scavenging agents

Question_Title: If an automatically fired burner ignites, but repeatedly goes out within two seconds, the cause could be a/an __________.
Answer_1: faulty pressure signal to the time delay relay circuit
Answer_3: burned out solenoid coil in the low fire oil valve

Question_Title: Where reaction turbine blading is fitted with shrouding of  end tightened design, which of the following conditions will be the most critical to efficient turbine operation?
Answer_3: Limiting the use of LP bleed steam

Question_Title: On a boiler safety valve, the blowdown adjusting ring is locked in place by a __________.
Flame scanners are used with boiler combustion control systems to monitor flame quality and to __________.
Answer_1: shut off the fuel supply if flame failure is detected
Answer_2: secure the fuel oil service pump in the event of a floor fire
Answer_3: secure the forced draft fan in the event of a flame failure
Answer_4: regulate the fuel/air ratio controller for more efficient combustion

Question_Title: Fuel oil settling tanks are used to __________.
Answer_2: separate water and solids from the fuel
Answer_3: make stripping of sludge and water from fuel oil easier

Question_Title: Which of the DC heater operations listed will result in excessive dissolved oxygen in boiler water?
Answer_1: Excessively high water level in the heater.
Answer_3: Operating the heater with a closed air vent.

Question_Title: Ultraviolet light sensing flame scanners installed on an automated main propulsion boiler, are designed so they __________.
Answer_1: might be misled by glowing brickwork
Answer_2: will be sensitive to the outer portion of flames
Answer_3: are sensitive only to the center of the ultraviolet portion of the flame from a particular burner
Answer_4: cannot be used with steam atomizing burners

Question_Title: Which of the boiler end points should be reached first?
The amount of oil atomized by a straight mechanical fuel oil burner depends on the sprayer plate size and the __________.
What are the two most common gases that dissolve in boiler  water and cause corrosion on the internal parts of the boiler?
Which of the following represents a significant system limitation to be aware of when a burner management system is operated in the 'HAND' mode?
Answer_1: Some boiler safety interlocks are bypassed when the boiler  is 'HAND' fired.
Answer_2: The burner is not capable of maintaining a high firing rate when the boiler is in the 'HAND' mode.
Answer_3: The flame failure alarm cannot function when the boiler is  'HAND' fired.
Answer_4: The burner sequence control is fully automatic even in the  'HAND' mode.

Question_Title: What happens to the steam as it moves across the moving blades in a reaction turbine?
Answer_1: It gains velocity at constant pressure.
Answer_2: It creates an axial thrust in the direction of the steam flow.
Answer_3: It loses velocity at constant pressure.
Answer_4: It creates an axial thrust opposing the direction of steam  flow.

Question_Title: An advantage of using boiler furnace studded water wall tubes packed with refractory is that __________.
Answer_3: lower quality steel can be used
Answer_4: the use of dense firebricks is not required

Question_Title: If the water level in the boiler water gage glass is not in sight, and the automatic feedwater regulator is in the closed position, the __________.
Answer_1: safety valve should be lifted by hand

Question_Title: Which of the following systems is designed to use auxiliary exhaust steam?
During cold ship start-up, you should open the feedwater outlet and condensate valves to a DC heater in order to __________.
Answer_2: expel noncondensable vapors from the vent

Question_Title: In a boiler automation system, if a burner fuel oil solenoid valve continually trips closed under normal steaming conditions, you should __________.
Answer_1: wedge the valve in the open position and report it to the chief engineer
Answer_2: bypass the solenoid valve and enter the fact in the logbook
Answer_3: secure the burner and determine the cause of the valve failure
Answer_4: wedge the valve in the open position and reduce the fuel oil pressure at that burner

Question_Title: The 'end point for combustion' for a boiler furnace is reached whenever __________.
Answer_1: the amount of heat being transferred to the tubes reaches a maximum no matter how much the firing rate is increased
Answer_2: panting of the furnace accompanied with black smoke takes place
Answer_3: the maximum rate at which the boiler can generate steam
Answer_4: the capacity of the sprayer plates at the designed pressure for the system is attained

Question_Title: The degree of fuel oil atomization is dependent upon the __________.
Chemicals are added to boiler feedwater to __________.
While your vessel is steaming with one boiler, the automatic combustion control system sensing line for the idle boiler  is accidentally opened.  How will this effect the steaming  boiler?
Packing rings installed on auxiliary turbines are lubricated by __________.
When the automatic combustion control fails, what should you do to control the air supply to a boiler?
Answer_2: Open the forced draft fan crossover damper.

Question_Title: When conducting a routine hydrostatic test on a water-tube  boiler, you should __________.
Answer_1: raise the temperature of the boiler water to 180Â°F
Answer_2: apply hydrostatic pressure equal to the maximum allowable working pressure of the boiler
Answer_3: have gags installed on all safety valves

Question_Title: Under normal operating conditions, a drop in the steam temperature leaving an uncontrolled interdeck superheater could be caused by a __________.
Answer_1: decrease in combustion gas velocity through the superheater
Answer_2: decrease in steam velocity through the superheater

Question_Title: If the boiler water and condenser hotwell levels are normal, but the DC heater level is only 30% of full, you should __________.
Answer_1: increase the speed of the condensate pump
Answer_2: open the feed pump recirculating valve wide
Answer_4: bypass the vent condenser and third-stage feed heater

Question_Title: Auxiliary exhaust steam can generally be used as a supply for the __________.
Reaching which of the boiler end points listed could cause  the most damage to a boiler?
High salinity can be reduced in a steaming boiler by adding caustic soda, phosphate, and then __________.
Answer_2: steaming at a low firing rate for 24 hours
Answer_3: adding hydrazine to control dissolved oxygen
Answer_4: adding calcium carbonate to precipitate solids

Question_Title: In a cross-compounded turbine, steam enters the __________.
Answer_1: high pressure, intermediate and low pressure units  simultaneously
Answer_2: high pressure unit and then flows to the low pressure unit
Answer_3: high and low pressure units simultaneously
Answer_4: high pressure unit and then flows to another high pressure  unit

Question_Title: Which of the following systems can normally be supplied by  auxiliary exhaust steam?
Under normal conditions, the rate of heat transfer in a feedwater heater is most greatly affected by the __________.
Answer_1: temperature differential between the steam and feedwater
Answer_4: speed of the main feed pump

Question_Title: The purpose of the steam control valves installed in the steam supply line to the DC heater is to __________.
Answer_1: control steam admission and to maintain the proper spray pattern
Answer_2: regulate back pressure in the auxiliary exhaust line
Answer_3: preheat the condensate before it enters the vent condenser
Answer_4: seal the vent to prevent the escape of condensate

Question_Title: Which set of boiler end points listed is considered to be the normal order of occurrence?
Which of the listed characteristics of fuel oil establishes the danger point as far as transferring, pumping, and firing procedures are concerned?
Which of the terms listed represents the ratio between the  highest and lowest fuel oil pressure at which the burners will remain ignited?
If a routine boiler water test indicates high salinity, you should blowdown the boiler to reduce salinity and then __________.
Answer_2: treat the boiler water with phosphates
Answer_3: reduce the firing rate to prevent scaling
Answer_4: increase the firing rate to prevent foaming

Question_Title: The steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.
In a cross-compounded turbine operating at full load, the total available steam energy is approximately divided between the HP and LP in the ratio of __________.
The turbogenerator steam stop is located between the superheater outlet and the main steam stop valve to __________.
Answer_2: provide higher quality steam for the turbogenerators
Answer_3: provide a flow of cooling steam through the control desuperheater
Answer_4: allow the use of superheated steam in the turbogenerator without pressurizing the larger main steam line

Question_Title: An increase in the pressure drop between the inlet and outlet of the feedwater heater waterside, not due to a waterside obstruction, would indicate __________.
Answer_1: insufficient water velocity through the heater
Answer_2: a water flow rate higher than feedwater heater design limits
Answer_3: fouling of the heater steam side
Answer_4: an accumulation of noncondensable gases in the steam circuit

Question_Title: Which of the drains listed could be led directly to a DC heater operating at 35 psig (343 kPa)?
Answer_2: Contaminated evaporator relief valve drain only.
Answer_4: Only those steam drains which operate at 35 psig (343 kPa)  or less.

Question_Title: Which of the following systems can be supplied by the auxiliary exhaust system?
Under normal operating conditions, a drop in the steam temperature leaving an interdeck-type superheater can be caused by a decrease in the velocity of the __________.
Answer_1: combustion gas flowing around the superheater tubes
Answer_2: steam flowing through the superheater tubes

Question_Title: In addition to the repeated use of surface blow to control boiler water chemistry, caustic soda may be used to treat high salinity, as well as __________.
Answer_2: phosphate, to aid in scale prevention
Answer_3: calcium carbonate, to assist in precipitating solids

Question_Title: Upon taking over the watch, while the vessel is at sea speed, you find the following conditions to exist.  Which condition should be attended to first and why should this step be taken?
Answer_1: Excessive recirculation of condensate.  Failure to properly adjust may cause an increase in condenser level leading to a decrease in condenser vacuum.
Answer_2: Salted up evaporator dumping to bilge.  Must immediately be restarted to prevent insufficient quantities of distilled and potable water.
Answer_3: High level in fuel oil sludge tank.  Necessary to pump contents to settler to prevent overflow of tank into the bilges.
Answer_4: Leaking air line to auxiliary exhaust live steam makeup valve actuator.  Repair or place in bypass control to insure proper pressures in the auxiliary exhaust steam system.

Question_Title: A turbine assembly in which steam flows in series through a high pressure turbine and then on to a low pressure turbine, with both turbines driving a common reduction gear through  separate shafts, is classed as __________.
The main steam stop valve on a "D" type boiler is located at the __________.
Dirty generating tube surfaces may cause higher than normal superheater outlet temperatures because __________.
Answer_1: the boiler must be overfired to maintain the required rate  of steam generation
Answer_2: the temperature of the gas leaving the generating banks will be lower than normal
Answer_3: the screen tubes absorb excessive heat and transfer the increased temperature to the superheater
Answer_4: gas laning will result causing overheating of the superheater

Question_Title: If there is a sudden drop in the outlet temperature of an uncontrolled superheater, you should __________.
Answer_3: check the water level in the drum
Answer_4: reduce the forced draft fan speed

Question_Title: In a modern high pressure steam plant, most feedwater deaeration takes place in the __________.
The limiting factor in determining the end point for combustion is usually the __________.
Answer_2: size of only the sprayer plates
Answer_3: fuel oil pressure as the only concern
Answer_4: ability of the forced draft fan to supply combustion air

Question_Title: Improper atomization can be caused by __________.
Answer_2: using the same size burner tips in all burners

Question_Title: In a steaming boiler most dissolved chlorides tend to concentrate at or near the __________.
In an impulse turbine, the fixed blades function to __________.
Answer_2: change the direction of steam flow

Question_Title: The main steam stop bypass valve is used to __________.
Answer_1: isolate the main steam stop for repairs while steaming
Answer_2: gradually increase the pressure and temperature of the main steam piping when warming up
Answer_4: supply auxiliary steam when the main steam stop is closed

Question_Title: Under normal conditions, steam to the DC heater is supplied directly from which of the systems listed?
Insufficient combustion air supply to the furnace would cause __________.
The designed function of fixed blades in an impulse turbine is to __________.
Answer_4: change the direction of steam flow

Question_Title: The bottom blow valve on a water-tube boiler is usually attached to the __________.
During normal operation the steam flow from the auxiliary exhaust line to the DC heater is a function of __________.
Answer_1: spring pressure of the spray valves
Answer_2: water level in the DC heater reservoir
Answer_3: rate of condensation in the DC heater
Answer_4: rate of evaporation in the DC heater

Question_Title: Insufficient combustion air supply to a boiler furnace can  cause __________.
A burner atomizer improperly positioned in the distance piece, may cause __________.
Answer_2: slag formation on the screen tubes
Answer_3: erosion of the screen tube baffles
Answer_4: the ends of the flame, farthest from the atomizers, to be a yellowish orange, or golden shade

Question_Title: Calcium minerals in boiler water are precipitated out of solution by the use of which of the listed chemicals?
A boiler internal feed pipe is perforated to __________.
Answer_1: provide positive flow to the downcomers
Answer_2: create a slight turbulence in the steam drum
Answer_3: distribute water evenly throughout the steam drum
Answer_4: reduce the weight of the steam drum internals

Question_Title: Gland sealing steam is used on propulsion turbines to prevent __________.
Answer_2: steam leakage through the casing drains
Answer_4: reversed steam flow at interstage bleeds

Question_Title: Boiler fuel savings gained by the use of an economizer can  amount to __________.
Answer_1: three percent for each 5Â°F rise in feed water temperature
Answer_2: one percent for each 10Â°F rise in feed water temperature
Answer_3: one half percent for each 15Â°F rise in feed water temperature
Answer_4: three percent for each 20Â°F rise in feed water temperature

Question_Title: A photoelectric cell is installed in an oil fired boiler safeguard system to introduce proper resistance values to the electronic control circuit.  This device is primarily sensitive to __________.
Answer_1: light emitted from the back wall incandescent brickwork
Answer_2: light emitted from the front wall incandescent brickwork
Answer_3: the orange portion of the flame spectrum
Answer_4: the blue portion of the flame spectrum

Question_Title: Treatment of boiler feedwater for the control of hardness is necessary to prevent __________.
In a DC heater, which source of steam is commonly used to heat and deaerate condensate?
Low steam pressure in a steaming boiler can be caused by __________.
Which of the following boiler stack (smoke color) conditions indicates efficient combustion?
If the temperature of the fuel oil entering an atomizer is  too low, the burner will __________.
Answer_3: produce heavy black smoke at any load condition
Answer_4: require more excess air for combustion

Question_Title: Of the impurities commonly found in marine lubricating oil, which of the following can NOT be removed by a centrifugal  purifier at normal operating temperatures?
If the boiler water level of one boiler drops out of sight  while your vessel is steaming, and the burners have been secured, you should __________.

When a high pressure turbine is operating at sea speed, the pressure of the steam leaking through the shaft gland packing may be slightly higher than the pressure setting of the gland seal regulator.  In this situation, the excess steam at the regulator is directed to the __________.
The phrase 'boiler water column' as defined in the  regulations, refers to the __________.
Answer_3: pressure head to the feedwater pump suction
Answer_4: pressure gauge reading in feet of water

Question_Title: Which of the following statements best describes the actions occurring to the oil as it flows through a disk type centrifugal purifier?
Answer_1: The purified oil is only thrown outward and away from the spindle of the machine.
Answer_2: Water, along with most of the dirt and sludge, is discharged past the discharge ring, located at the top of the bowl.
Answer_3: Most of the dirt and sludge is forced to accumulate on the  vertical surfaces of the bowl.
Answer_4: As the dirty oil flows down through the distribution holes  in the disks, the high centrifugal force causes the water to move outward.

Question_Title: Dissolved oxygen in the condensate can result from __________.
Answer_1: steam leaks into the gland leakoff
Answer_2: air leaks through the turbine glands
Answer_3: improper operation of the gland exhauster
Answer_4: vapor lock in the condensate pump

Question_Title: Incomplete combustion due to insufficient air yields an excess amount of __________.
If a burner were inserted too far into the boiler furnace,  it could cause carbon deposits on the __________.
To minimize metal corrosion, boiler water is best kept __________.
In a disk type centrifugal purifier, the bowl is mounted on the upper end of the __________.
The boiler feed check valves are located at the __________.
A centrifuge should satisfactorily remove which of the listed substances from lube oil?
A sulfite test is performed on boiler water to determine the amount of __________.
Which of the following statements represents the function of a turbine gland exhaust condenser?
Answer_1: Assists in preheating the condensate before it enters the DC heater.
Answer_2: Recovers condensate formed at the gland seal exhaust leak off.
Answer_3: Directs the gland exhaust from the turbine sealing glands to the air ejector suction.
Answer_4: Recovers condensate from the gland leakage around the ahead  and astern throttle valves.

Question_Title: Insufficient air for combustion in a boiler furnace could result in a __________.
Which of the following represents the function of the diffuser used with a mechanical atomizing oil burner?
Answer_1: Provide flame stability at the atomizer tip.
Answer_2: Control the amount of secondary combustion air.
Answer_3: Complete the vaporization of the fuel for combustion.
Answer_4: Finely divide the fuel particles into a cone-shaped spray.

Question_Title: A sulfite test is conducted on boiler water to check for __________.
One function of the disks, in a disk-type centrifugal purifier, is to divide the bowl space into many separate passages to __________.
Answer_1: minimize agitation of the oil-water mixture
Answer_2: increase hydraulic head needed for proper circulation

Question_Title: The main propulsion shaft turning gear usually connects to  the free end of the high-speed high pressure pinion because the __________.
Answer_1: lubricating oil from the high-speed pinion can easily supply the turning gears
Answer_2: turning gears are double reduction worm type and cannot mate with the low pressure high-speed pinion
Answer_3: arrangement allows for the use of a muff type coupling for  flexibility and smooth engagement
Answer_4: greatest gear ratio between the turning gear motor output and bull gear can be obtained

Question_Title: A boiler feed stop-valve must be mounted __________.
Answer_1: between the feed check valve and the boiler drum
Answer_2: between the feed pump and the feed check valve
Answer_4: at or near the engine room operating platform

Question_Title: A boiler internal feed pipe is perforated to __________.
Answer_1: provide positive downward circulation at high loads
Answer_2: distribute the feedwater throughout the steam drum
Answer_3: reduce back pressure in the feedwater piping
Answer_4: reduce the overall weight of the drum internals

Question_Title: When the flow of oil admitted to a disk-type centrifugal purifier is in excess of its designed capacity, which of the  following conditions will usually occur?
Answer_1: The oil will discharged through the heavy phase discharge port.
Answer_2: The speed of the centrifuge will increase.
Answer_3: All water will be retained by the purified oil being discharge.
Answer_4: Oil will be present in the water sealing line to the bowl.

Question_Title: The gland exhaust fan draws steam and noncondensable vapors from the gland exhaust condenser and discharges to the __________.
The water level in a steaming boiler has risen to within 2  inches of the top of the top gage glass.  Your immediate action should be to __________.
Answer_2: reduce the feedwater flow to the boiler
Answer_3: secure the feedwater flow to the boiler

Question_Title: Insufficient combustion air supply will cause an atomizer flame to appear as a __________.
Answer_3: dull red flame with black streaks
Answer_4: light yellow flame with white streaks

Question_Title: The purpose of the diffuser in a boiler burner assembly is  to __________.
Answer_1: break up fuel oil into a fine spray
Answer_2: assist combustion by heating incoming air
Answer_3: shield the flame from the incoming air blast while allowing some mixing of fuel and air
Answer_4: diffuse flame to all corners of the furnace

Question_Title: Prior to relieving the watch you should first check the fireroom status by verifying the boiler steam drum level and _________.
Answer_4: steam atomization temperature to the mechanical atomizers

Question_Title: A nozzle in an impulse turbine functions to __________.
Answer_2: guide the steam through the fixed blades
Answer_3: convert the steam's thermal energy to kinetic energy
Answer_4: convert the steam's kinetic energy to thermal energy

Question_Title: Steam baffles are used in the steam drum of a water-tube boiler to __________.
Answer_1: support the drum safety valve nozzles

Question_Title: Which of the following chemicals is used in an Orsat apparatus to absorb carbon dioxide?
Any feedwater testing done on a routine basis would normally include testing for __________.
When raising vacuum on an auxiliary condenser, which of the following steps is necessary?
Answer_1: Close the makeup feed drag line to raise hotwell level.
Answer_2: Open the auxiliary condensate recirculation valve from the auxiliary air ejector condenser outlet.
Answer_3: Rotate turbine with hand jacking gear while applying gland  seal steam.
Answer_4: Close condensate pump vent line to eliminate air leaks.

Question_Title: When operating under constant load, the superheated steam temperature may rise above normal if the __________.

Assuming all burners are clean and the fuel oil is at the correct temperature, it is considered good practice to adjust the excess air until a light brown haze is obtained. With the aid of a chemical based flue gas analyzer, the percentage readings (not necessarily in order) should indicate __________.
Answer_1: no CO, low O2, and high CO2
Answer_2: low CO2, no O2, and high CO
Answer_3: high CO, high CO2, and no O2
Answer_4: high O2, low CO, and low CO2

Question_Title: The measured gap between the face of the burner atomizer tip nut and the diffuser plate, is determined by the setting of the __________.
Chemicals are added to boiler water by injecting them __________.
Answer_1: as a powder into the mud drum
Answer_2: as a powder into the steam drum
Answer_3: in solution into the main feed line
Answer_4: in solution through the chemical feed pipe

Question_Title: The size of the discharge ring used in a lube oil purifier  is determined by the oil's __________.
A factor in determining the minimum steam temperature permitted at the turbine inlet is the __________.
Answer_3: moisture content in the steam at the LP end of the turbine
Answer_4: specific volume of the steam in the low pressure end of the turbine

Question_Title: Combustion gases can leak into the fireroom through __________.
Answer_4: soot blower swivel tube packing glands

Question_Title: Natural circulation in a marine boiler is a result of __________.
Answer_1: the difference in the densities of the fluid in the downcomer and riser circuits
Answer_2: the fact that the specific weight of steam is greater than  water
Answer_3: the velocity imparted to the feedwater by the feed pump
Answer_4: the turbulence of high pressure feedwater entering the steam drum

Question_Title: While vacuum is being raised on the main unit and the turbine warmed, condensate is recirculated to the main condenser to __________.
Answer_1: ensure the condensation of air ejector steam
Answer_2: cool the main condenser shell for better vacuum
Answer_4: maintain a proper DC heater water level

Question_Title: Why should a boiler furnace be purged before the first burner is lit off?
Answer_1: To control air pressure in the windbox.
Answer_2: To ensure a proper fuel to air ratio.
Answer_3: To clear the furnace of any explosive gases.
Answer_4: To make the fires easier to light.

Question_Title: White stack smoke could indicate __________.
Answer_1: excessive air leakage through the inner casing

Question_Title: The diffuser of a burner register assembly __________.
Answer_1: acts as a shield to prevent flare back
Answer_2: shapes the fuel particles into a cone
Answer_3: serves to make the air mix evenly with the oil
Answer_4: adds heat to the fuel particle cone

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions should be observed when  adding treatment chemicals to the boiler compound tank?
Answer_1: Cool the feedwater before it enters the tank.
Answer_2: Ensure there is no pressure on the tank before opening it.
Answer_3: Raise the boiler water level before adding chemicals.

Question_Title: Scavenging air is supplied to steam soot blower elements to __________.
Answer_1: prevent back up of combustion gases into soot blower heads
Answer_2: provide cooling air when soot blower elements are rotating  through blowing arcs
Answer_3: prevent build up of soot on the element

Question_Title: When a turbine rotor is not rotating during maneuvering, the heat tends to be concentrated at the __________.
Which of the valves listed should be closed before lighting off a boiler?
The bulk of the solid material entering a centrifugal purifier with lube oil is __________.
Excess free oxygen in the boiler feedwater can result from  __________.
Answer_1: improper operation of the DC heater
Answer_2: steam leaks through the turbine glands
Answer_3: improper operation of the gland exhauster
Answer_4: vapor lock in the boiler feed pump

Question_Title: In a marine condenser designed with a reheating hotwell, the hotwell is reheated by __________.
Answer_3: a branch line from the air ejector steam supply
Answer_4: submerged heating coils supplied with auxiliary exhaust steam

Question_Title: To properly use a tube expander, the expander should be placed in the tube to be rolled so that the __________.
Answer_1: belling section is flattened against the tube sheet
Answer_2: rollers bear on the portion of the tube which needs belling
Answer_3: mandrel is in direct contact with the inner-tube sheet
Answer_4: rollers bear on the portion of the tube which is in the tube sheet

Question_Title: Black smoke issuing from the boiler stack can be caused by  an improper fuel/air ratio and by __________.
When used as a separator, a centrifugal purifier may lose its seal and cause __________.
Answer_1: water to contaminate the lube oil
Answer_2: the purifier pump to lose suction
Answer_3: water flow from the oil discharge
Answer_4: oil flow from the water discharge

Question_Title: In a water-tube boiler, sludge is most likely to collect in the __________.
Longitudinal expansion of a boiler water drum is allowed for at the boiler __________.
Before placing the jacking gear in operation on a main turbine unit, you must always __________.
Answer_4: line up and start the lube oil system

Question_Title: Slag buildup on boiler furnace refractory is undesirable because it causes __________.
Answer_1: peeling or spalling of the brickwork

Question_Title: A boiler is to be secured in port.  After the burners have  been secured, the forced draft fan and air registers should be secured __________.
Answer_1: immediately after carrying out the former procedures
Answer_2: after any oil on the furnace floor has been burned off and  cleared of combustion gases
Answer_3: after 30 minutes has elapsed, after carrying out these procedures
Answer_4: after at least 1 hour has elapsed, after carrying out these securing procedures

Question_Title: Dissolved gases are removed from boiler feedwater because they may cause __________.
Answer_4: vapor lock in the feed pumps

Question_Title: The main condenser is designed with a reheating hotwell. What will occur if the condensate level rises above the top of the hotwell, yet remains below the bottom row of tubes?
Water-tube boiler screen tubes protect which of the listed  components from high furnace temperatures?
The boiler uptake periscope appears completely black, this  could indicate __________.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: Any abnormal condition or emergency occurring in the fireroom must be immediately reported to the __________.
What boiler water chemistry is necessary to ensure the precipitation of hard scale forming calcium?
Answer_1: Hydrazine concentrations should be at the proper level.
Answer_2: Boiler water hardness should be high.
Answer_3: Boiler water should be slightly acidic.
Answer_4: Boiler water should have a reserve of phosphates.

Question_Title: Prior to lighting a burner in a cold boiler, you should __________.
The jacking gear on main propulsion turbines can be used to __________.
Repeated priming in a steaming boiler can cause damage to the __________.
Water is best removed from lubricating oil by __________.
Excessive water loss from the main feed system can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: an atmospheric drain tank trap frozen in the closed position
Answer_2: excessive recirculation of condensate from the outlet of the air ejector condenser to the main condenser
Answer_3: a vapor bound main condensate pump
Answer_4: a leak in the desuperheater internal gasket

Question_Title: With the steam control valve wide open during normal operation, the rate of steam flow from the auxiliary exhaust steam line to the DC heater is actually a function  of __________.
Answer_1: rate of condensation in the DC heater
Answer_2: spring pressure of the spray valves
Answer_3: water level in the DC heater reservoir
Answer_4: rate of evaporation in the DC heater

Question_Title: Water circulation in a water-tube boiler is a result of the __________.
Answer_1: difference between the area and length of the water-tubes
Answer_2: differences in density within the circulated water
Answer_3: velocity added to the water by the feed pump
Answer_4: siphon action of steam leaving the drum

Question_Title: If a boiler is smoking black, and increasing the excess air does not reduce the smoke, the cause can be __________.
To safely reduce a high water level in a steaming boiler, you should __________.
The primary difference between sludge and scale deposits in boiler tubes is __________.
Answer_1: scale forms only on the cooler boiler tubes whereas sludge  forms on all tubes
Answer_2: scale forms as the result of the crystallization of salts,  whereas sludge may consist of reaction products from boiler treatment
Answer_3: sludge is hard and nonadherent at operating temperatures, whereas scale can be deposited at any boiler temperature range
Answer_4: scale is heavier than water and forms in lower drums and headers, whereas sludge is more likely to form along the steam drum waterline

Question_Title: If the gage glass water level remains constant in a steaming boiler while maneuvering, the most probable cause is a __________.
The jacking gear is used in preparation for starting a marine turbine and reduction gear unit to __________.
Answer_1: allow the rotor to cool evenly
Answer_2: allow a film of oil to form on the spring bearings
Answer_3: prevent the gland seal steam from distorting the rotor
Answer_4: listen for rubbing noises from the gland seal condenser

Question_Title: Severe priming in a boiler can cause damage to the  __________.
Which of the following represents one of the most important considerations in the design and location of the boiler internal feed pipe?
Answer_1: Water must be directed toward the downcomers.
Answer_2: Feedwater must be directed to the swash baffles.
Answer_3: Thermal shock to the boiler drum must be avoided.
Answer_4: Holes must be drilled in both the upper and lower portion of the internal feed pipe.

Question_Title: Zincs are installed in the main and auxiliary condenser waterboxes to __________.
The possibility of a flareback in a boiler will be reduced  if you __________.
Answer_1: rotate the soot blower elements one complete revolution prior to lighting off
Answer_2: maintain the fuel oil to the burner at the flash point
Answer_3: supply a minimum of excess air
Answer_4: purge the furnace with fresh air prior to lighting off

Question_Title: Boiler stack gas temperature could be higher than normal if __________.
Answer_1: leakage exists in the inner and outer casing
Answer_2: defects exist in the burner cone refractory
Answer_3: fuel oil temperature is excessively high
Answer_4: secondary combustion occurs in the gas passages

Question_Title: Which ring dam arrangement should be used for centrifugal purification?
Answer_1: The largest inside diameter ring without loss of oil.
Answer_2: The largest outside diameter ring without loss of oil.
Answer_3: The smallest inside diameter ring without loss of oil.
Answer_4: The smallest outside diameter ring without loss of oil.

Question_Title: Scale prevention in boiler water is accomplished by adding  treatment chemicals to __________.
Answer_1: precipitate scale forming salts as sludge
Answer_4: cause the water to be neutral

Question_Title: When a boiler has been secured and is being intially cooled, the water level showing in the steam drum gage glass should be  __________.
Answer_4: allowed to go out of sight

Question_Title: If steam is admitted to the main propulsion turbine with the jacking gear engaged, which of the following problems can occur?
Answer_3: A possibility of shearing the jacking gear flexible coupling.
Answer_4: Excessive tooth stress on the high pressure first reduction pinion.

Question_Title: If boiler priming occurs, you should immediately __________.
Answer_2: open the superheater and main engine throttle drains
Answer_3: lift the safety valves with the hand easing gear
Answer_4: open the boiler bottom blow valve

Question_Title: High boiler water level can cause carryover and __________.
In a boiler, water flows downward in tubes furthest from the fires and flows upward in tubes nearest the fires because __________.
Answer_1: water is denser in the tubes farthest from the fires
Answer_2: water is less dense in the tubes farthest from the fires
Answer_3: tubes farthest from the fires have a greater diameter
Answer_4: tubes farthest from the fires have a smaller diameter

Question_Title: Air trapped within the main condenser shell is harmful because it will __________.
Answer_1: decrease the turbine exhaust steam temperature
Answer_2: cause the turbine casing to warp and bow
Answer_3: decrease the vacuum in the main condenser
Answer_4: cause heat to be transferred too rapidly

Question_Title: When an oil purification centrifuge loses a portion of its  seal, the oil can then be discharged through the heavy phase discharge port.  This is partly a result of greater __________.
Answer_1: centrifugal force being developed on the oil near the interface
Answer_2: centripetal force being developed on the oil near the interface
Answer_3: centrifugal force being developed on the water seal at the  side of the bowl
Answer_4: centripetal force being developed on the water seal at the  side of the bowl

Question_Title: In a steaming boiler, higher than normal stack gas  temperature can be caused by __________.
Answer_4: delayed burning due to inadequate excess air

Question_Title: After restoring the normal water level in a boiler  following a high water casualty, you should __________.
Answer_1: immediately put the boiler on the line
Answer_2: reduce the firing rate to the minimum

Question_Title: The most effective way to eliminate sludge from boiler water is to __________.
Answer_4: give the boiler a bottom blow

Question_Title: The water seal in a centrifuge, operating at normal speed,  prevents the lube oil from discharging from the water outlet.  Another function of the seal is to __________.
Answer_1: develop permanent emulsions with the lube oil
Answer_2: provide a means of 'washing' the oil as it passes through the bowl
Answer_3: keep the bowl at a temperature below that of the lube oil input
Answer_4: provide an area for separated water to pass and create a path to remove the water from the bowl

Question_Title: The axial position of a turbine rotor is normally adjusted  by varying the thickness of the __________.
Which of the actions listed should be carried out immediately after securing the fires in one boiler of a two boiler ship?
Answer_1: Relieve all fuel oil service pressure to that boiler.
Answer_2: Open the air registers wide to cool the furnace.
Answer_3: Drain and refill the boiler with cold water.

Question_Title: If the fires to a steaming boiler have been accidently extinguished, you should not relight any burner until __________.
Answer_1: all burning embers in the furnace are extinguished
Answer_2: the furnace refractory has cooled below ignition temperature
Answer_3: the boiler furnace has been thoroughly purged
Answer_4: all fuel has been recirculated from the burners

Question_Title: During the operation of a lube oil centrifuge, a thin emulsion interface occurs between the lube oil and seal. The position of this interface is determined by the __________.
Answer_1: number of disks in the disk stack
Answer_2: outside diameter of the discharge ring
Answer_3: inside diameter of the ring dam
Answer_4: initial volume of seal water admitted to the bowl

Question_Title: Which of the condensers listed is cooled by sea water?
Which of the following statements is true concerning lube oil coolers?
Answer_1: The temperature of the oil is less than that of the cooling water.
Answer_2: The pressure of the oil is less than that of the cooling water.
Answer_3: The pressure of the oil is greater than that of the cooling water.
Answer_4: Magnets are installed in the tube sheets to remove metal particles.

Question_Title: A higher than normal stack gas temperature could indicate __________.
The original bridge gage reading for a reduction gear bearing was measured as .008 inches.  A year later, the bridge gage reading for the same bearing is .010 inches. This indicates __________.
When preparing to get underway and the jacking gear has been disengaged, the main unit should NOT remain stationary for  more than 3 to 5 minutes, because __________.
Answer_1: uneven heating from gland seal steam can distort the rotor
Answer_2: the turbine drain lines can fill with condensate
Answer_3: main condenser vacuum will drop rapidly without steam flow  through the main unit
Answer_4: with no rotor movement, the journal bearings may overheat due to reduced lube oil flow

Question_Title: The steam drum air cock is normally opened when cooling down a boiler to __________.
Answer_1: relieve any residual air pressure in the drum
Answer_2: prevent a vacuum forming in the steam drum
Answer_3: reduce the pressure in the drum more rapidly

Question_Title: In order to obtain the best performance with a lube oil purifier, the lube oil inlet temperature should __________.
Answer_1: never exceed the highest main engine bearing temperature
Answer_2: be equal to the normal lube oil cooler outlet temperature
Answer_3: never exceed the normal lube oil cooler outlet temperature  by more than 55Â°F
Answer_4: be maintained in a temperature range of 160Â°F to a maximum  of 180Â°F

Question_Title: Chamfers, located at the parting edges of horizontal split  sleeve type bearings, are used to facilitate oil storage and distribution. They are machined __________.
Answer_1: radially the full length of the bearing
Answer_2: axially the full length of the bearing
Answer_3: radially, to within 45 degrees of the normal bearing surface
Answer_4: axially, approaching but not extending to the end of the bearing

Question_Title: After the steam leaves the low pressure turbine, it enters  the __________.
To allow for water drum expansion or contraction, the boiler is fitted with __________.
If the stack temperature is higher than normal, this could  indicate __________.
The maximum lube oil temperature leaving a large, main propulsion steam turbine bearing should __________.
Answer_3: never exceed the inlet temperature by more than 55Â°F
Answer_4: not exceed the normal lube oil outlet temperature from the  centrifugal purifier

Question_Title: In a marine boiler, maximum heat transfer rates can be obtained by __________.
Answer_1: maintaining the recommended boiler water pH
Answer_2: treating the boiler water with oxygen scavenging chemicals
Answer_3: maintaining the feedwater temperature 212Â°F in the  economizer
Answer_4: keeping the watersides free from scale deposits

Question_Title: The jacking gear must be engaged as quickly as possible when securing the main turbines in order to __________.
Answer_1: permit rapid cooling of the reduction gears
Answer_2: prevent uneven cooling of the turbine rotors
Answer_3: maintain a constant supply of lube oil to the main unit
Answer_4: prevent the stern tube bearing from overheating

Question_Title: After a boiler has been taken off the line and is cooling,  the air cock is opened to __________.
Answer_1: purge all air from the steam drum
Answer_2: allow even cooling of the steam drum
Answer_3: guard against entrapped gas pockets in the superheater
Answer_4: prevent the formation of a vacuum within the boiler

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is true concerning the boiler water drum foundations?
Answer_1: All saddles are a rigid support and are welded directly to  the ship's framework.
Answer_2: In a typical installation, the water drum is secured solidly to the ship's foundation on one end and free to move on the other.
Answer_3: Good preventive maintenance practice includes chipping the  sliding feet and phosphorous bronze chocks to remove all rust and corrosion to insure free movement.

Question_Title: The maximum lube oil temperature leaving the lube oil cooler of a main steam turbine propulsion system should __________.
Answer_2: never be more than 60Â°F below the lube oil inlet temperature
Answer_4: be dictated only by the existing sea water temperature

Question_Title: Proper vacuum must be maintained in the main condenser to __________.
Which of the types of superheaters listed has the flattest  superheat temperature curve?
Carbon deposits in a boiler furnace, as a result of oil impingement, can be caused by __________.
Chemicals are added to boiler water in order to __________.
Answer_2: reduce the total dissolved solids content

Question_Title: Before lighting any burner in a cold boiler you should always __________.
The main propulsion turbine should be operated with the __________.
Answer_1: lowest practical chest pressure and the minimum number of nozzles required to maintain the desired speed
Answer_2: lowest practical chest pressure and the maximum number of nozzles possible to maintain the desired speed
Answer_3: highest practical chest pressure and the minimum number of  nozzles required to maintain the desired speed
Answer_4: highest practical chest pressure and the maximum number of  nozzles possible to maintain the desired speed

Question_Title: The internal feed pipe in a D-type marine boiler __________.
Answer_1: distributes feedwater evenly throughout the steam drum
Answer_2: guides the feedwater toward the downcomer tubes
Answer_3: is located well above the normal steam drum water level to  assist in deaeration of feedwater
Answer_4: is drilled with holes to provide even distribution of boiler feedwater chemicals

Question_Title: On an automated vessel steaming at full sea speed, which of the following engine room responses will automatically be actuated by changing the bridge throttle control from full  ahead to slow ahead?
Answer_1: Main turbine extraction valves will open.
Answer_4: First-stage feedwater heater will be bypassed.

Question_Title: Burning fuel with entrained saltwater, will cause a glassy  slag formation on furnace refractory.  This slag will __________.
Answer_1: form a protective coating thus increasing its life
Answer_2: seal refractory joints thereby improving its function
Answer_3: expand at a different rate and result in damaged refractory
Answer_4: increase the furnace efficiency because of reduced firebox  turbulence

Question_Title: While underway, vacuum in the main condenser is primarily caused by the __________.
Answer_1: suction drawn by the condensate pump

Question_Title: The dirty oil inlet on centrifugal lube oil purifiers is located at the __________.
Answer_1: top of the tubular bowl type
Answer_2: bottom of the tubular bowl type
Answer_3: top or bottom of the disk type depending upon whether the unit is to be operated as a separator or clarifier
Answer_4: bottom only of the disk type

Question_Title: Boiler stack gas temperatures will be higher than normal when __________.
Answer_1: fuel temperature at the burners is excessively high
Answer_2: not enough excess air is being supplied for combustion
Answer_3: secondary combustion is occurring in the gas passages
Answer_4: internal water wall refractory baffles have failed

Question_Title: What is the quickest way to shutoff the boiler fuel oil supply from inside the fireroom?
Answer_1: Closing the settling tank suction valves.
Answer_3: Close the double bottom suction valves.

Question_Title: Chemicals are added to boiler water to __________.
Answer_2: stabilize feedwater if a boiler becomes salted up
Answer_4: maintain an acidic condition in the feedwater

Question_Title: To avoid acid corrosion of the economizer tubes when blowing tubes __________.
Maintaining low pressure in a condensing turbine exhaust trunk __________.
Answer_1: enables better utilization of available heat energy to perform work
Answer_2: eliminates creep problems in the exhaust trunk during maneuvering
Answer_3: reduces condensate depression with low seawater temperature
Answer_4: prevents steam turbulence in the exhaust trunk due to steam laning

Question_Title: The maximum, safe, upper limit temperature of lubricating oil discharged from the purifiers is __________.
Which of the following methods is used to securely fasten the babbitt lining of a reduction gear bearing to its shell?
Answer_1: The babbitt is centrifugally spun into the bearings or cast under a pressure head.
Answer_2: The babbitt is relieved in way of the split and held in place by locking pins.
Answer_3: The babbitt is securely bonded to the shell by the pressure of the hydrodynamic oil wedge.
Answer_4: The babbitt has a crescent shaped pocket cast symmetrically about the bearing split.

Question_Title: In a "D" type marine boiler, operating under constant load, which of the following conditions could cause the superheated steam temperature to rise above normal?
In which of the following types of condensers would you find the cooling water passing through tubes with the turbogenerator exhaust steam directed around the outside of the tubes?
A poorly cleaned lube oil purifier bowl may result in __________.
Answer_1: insufficient oil supply to the gravity tank

Question_Title: Low stack gas temperatures should be avoided in order to reduce the __________.
Answer_1: percentage of carbon monoxide in the stack gas

Question_Title: You can secure the fuel supply to the boilers from outside  the fireroom by __________.
Answer_2: operating the double bottom sluice valves with the reach rod
Answer_3: closing the master oil valve with the reach rod
Answer_4: closing the oil recirculating valve with the remote control

Question_Title: The end products of reactions occurring when boiler water is chemically treated, remain in the boiler and increase the need for __________.
Proper vacuum must be maintained during prolonged astern operation to __________.
Answer_1: eliminate leaving loss in the ahead blading
Answer_2: minimize any appreciable amount of condensate depression
Answer_3: ensure proper action of the condenser sentinel valve or back pressure trip
Answer_4: prevent overheating of the ahead blading

Question_Title: While raising steam on a cold boiler, the air cock is to be closed after __________.
Answer_1: the boiler is cut in on the line
Answer_2: steam has formed and all air is vented
Answer_4: all burners have been lit and firing normally

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true regarding lube oil coolers used for main steam propulsion systems?
Answer_1: Regulating the inlet water flow to a lube oil cooler may result in air binding of the water side.
Answer_2: A lube oil cooler is typically constructed as a cross-flow  type heat exchanger.
Answer_3: If an automatically controlled bypass valve controls the lube oil temperature, it will be used to regulate the lube oil  flow out of the cooler.
Answer_4: The lube oil usually flows thru the tubes and the cooling water around the tubes.

Question_Title: The term 'separation' as used in oil purification refers to the removal of __________.
A main condenser utilizing a scoop for the circulation of seawater must be constructed as a __________.
Under normal firing rates, a reduction of the steam outlet  temperature from an uncontrolled superheater could be caused by __________.
Low stack gas temperature should be avoided to reduce __________.
All fuel oil service pumps are equipped with a __________.
Answer_1: relief valve on the suction side
Answer_2: combustion control valve on the discharge side
Answer_3: remote means of stopping the pump
Answer_4: direct suction to the double bottom tanks

Question_Title: One of the purposes of chemically treating boiler water is to __________.
Why is it important to maintain good vacuum in a main turbine unit while operating astern?
Answer_1: Reduces windage loss in the astern section.
Answer_2: Prevents the ahead element from operating backwards.
Answer_3: Maintains proper temperatures in the ahead stage.
Answer_4: Limits the amount of time necessary to operate astern.

Question_Title: The purpose of the boiler drum air cock is to __________.
Answer_1: admit air when the boiler is being emptied
Answer_2: permit escape of air when the boiler is being filled
Answer_3: permit escape of air when steam is forming in the drum after lighting off

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning the operation  of a lube oil purifier is correct?
Answer_1: They should be operated as clarifiers for optimum moisture  removal.
Answer_2: They should be operated at maximum design speed and recommended operating capacity.
Answer_3: They should be operated as slowly as possible to ensure a long service life.
Answer_4: They should not be primed with water when operated as a separator.

Question_Title: In order to maintain the required lube oil temperature leaving a lube oil cooler, where an automatic bypass valve  is not provided, which of the following operations is correct?
Answer_1: The cooling water to the lube oil cooler is directly regulated to maintain the proper lube oil temperature.
Answer_2: The lube oil velocity to the cooler is regulated.
Answer_3: The cooling water flow rate leaving the cooler is directly  regulated.
Answer_4: The lube oil velocity from the cooler is regulated.

Question_Title: Excessive soot deposits on the heating surfaces of a boiler uncontrolled interdeck superheater would be indicated by __________.
Answer_1: decreased fuel oil and air requirements

Question_Title: Lube oil is preheated before centrifuging in order to __________.
Answer_3: reduce friction of the rotating components of the centrifuge

Question_Title: Which of the following represents the proper color of the flame farthest from an atomizer during normal operations?
The relief valve on the discharge side of the fuel oil service pump may discharge directly to the suction side of  the pump, or to the __________.
What is the purpose of chemically treating boiler water?
Answer_1: To reduce formation of scale on the waterside of the boiler.
Answer_2: To reduce to a minimum corrosion of boiler metal.
Answer_3: To reduce foaming and moisture carryover.

Question_Title: Which of the following would contribute to the formation of an oil and water emulsion, in addition to acid formation?
Answer_2: Solid insoluble particles, aeration, and heat

Question_Title: The FIRST step in breaking vacuum on a main turbine unit should be to __________.
Answer_1: secure the steam to the main air ejector
Answer_2: secure the steam to the gland seal system

Question_Title: Which of the following is the best reason for opening the air cock when draining a water-tube boiler?
Answer_1: With the air cock open, the boiler drains without producing a vacuum.
Answer_2: Water flows out of the boiler too rapidly with the air cock closed.
Answer_3: Air mixed with the water will create a cleansing effect in  the tubes.
Answer_4: Air coming into the boiler will help dry out the boiler's surface.

Question_Title: The peeling of boiler refractory associated with slagging,  is caused by the __________.
Answer_1: shrinkage of brickwork adjacent to slag coated refractory
Answer_2: chemical action of the slag on the firebrick surface
Answer_3: difference in the rate of expansion between the firebrick and slag coating
Answer_4: uneven heating of the brickwork during boiler warm up

Question_Title: The purpose of the cam-actuated steam valve used in a boiler soot blower system, is to __________.
Answer_1: rotate the element through a predetermined blowing arc
Answer_2: automatically blow the elements in the proper sequence
Answer_3: automatically secure steam to the blower head any time the  element stops turning
Answer_4: prevent steam from entering the soot blower when the element holes are directed toward the refractory

Question_Title: If the pressure becomes excessive in the auxiliary exhaust  system, the excess steam will be dumped to the __________.
A cause of high superheater outlet temperature is _________,
Answer_3: excessive fuel oil temperature at the settlers

Question_Title: Which color burner flame would indicate too much excess air?
The relief valve on the discharge side of the fuel oil service pump may discharge directly to the settler, or to the __________.
An increase in the concentration of total dissolved solids  in boiler water can result from __________.
A centrifuge will satisfactorily remove which of the listed substances from lube oil?
To raise vacuum on the main turbine unit, you should __________.
Answer_1: start the lube oil pump after starting the jacking gear
Answer_2: warm up and drain the main steam lines
Answer_3: pump the main condenser hotwell dry
Answer_4: admit gland sealing steam to the turbine glands

Question_Title: A nozzle reaction safety valve will lift at a pressure lower than required if the __________.
Answer_1: adjusting ring is set too low

Question_Title: Under otherwise normal operating conditions, a drop in the  steam temperature leaving an uncontrolled interdeck-type superheater could be caused by a/an __________.
Answer_1: increase in combustion gas velocity through the superheater
Answer_2: decrease in steam velocity through the superheater

Question_Title: In a tubular-bowl type centrifugal lube oil purifier, any solids separated from the oil are __________.
In a closed feed and water cycle, which of the conditions listed could prevent vacuum from reaching the desired level?
Answer_1: Steam leaking from the turbine glands.
Answer_2: Marine growth on the cooling water side of the main condenser.

Question_Title: An incandescent white flame in a boiler firebox would indicate __________.

Answer_4: preparing to light off a cold boiler

Question_Title: An adequate phosphate reserve should be maintained in boiler water to __________.
Main steam turbine bearings are lined with __________.

Answer_4: overheating of the second-stage air ejector

Question_Title: Babbitt is a metal alloy commonly used for lining __________.

Question_Title: Phosphates are used in the chemical treatment of boiler water to __________.

Answer_3: neutralize the harmful effects of hydrogen embrittlement

Answer_3: improper functioning of the air ejectors
Answer_4: loss of suction at the condensate pump

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct regarding the  selection of the proper size ring dam for a tubular-type lube oil purifier?

Answer_2: While all ring dams have the same inside diameter, the outside diameters vary.

Boiler water hardness in modern high pressure boilers should be kept as close to 'zero' as possible by chemically treating with __________.

Question_Title: The purpose of the sentinel valve installed on a turbine casing is to __________.

Answer_2: warn the engineer of excessive pressure in the low pressure turbine casing
Answer_3: relieve excess pressure to the turbine extraction points

Question_Title: What is the primary operational difference between a nozzle reaction safety valve and a huddling chamber safety valve?
Answer_1: The principle by which blowdown is accomplished.

Question_Title: The recommended vacuum should be maintained in the main condenser to __________.
Answer_2: recover latent heat from turbine exhaust steam
Answer_3: recover sensible heat from turbine exhaust steam
Answer_4: utilize the greatest possible amount of energy

Question_Title: If an analysis of boiler flue gas determines there is 100%  excess air for combustion, you should expect the flue gas to have a nitrogen content of approximately __________.

Answer_3: maintain a high boiler water level
Answer_4: add foaming agents to the boiler water

Answer_1: bypass exhaust steam to the main condenser

Answer_4: relieve excess pressure when the astern throttle is opened

Question_Title: When excessive static boiler pressure has resulted in the initial lift of the valve disc, a huddling chamber safety valve will continue to lift open as a result of ___________,
Answer_1: steam pressure acting on the enlarged area of projecting lip or ring

Answer_2: Do nothing in particular as this is a common occurrence aboard this vessel.
Answer_3: It is only necessary to immediately open the automatic make-up feed bypass valve.
Answer_4: Open the make-up feed valve bypass and check the condenser  level immediately.

Question_Title: Prior to relieving the watch you should first check the fireroom status by verifying the boiler steam drum level and _________.

Question_Title: One of the basic rules applying to the operation of a single-pass main condenser, is that the __________.

Answer_2: vacuum must be maintained at 29.92" of Hg. under all operating conditions
Answer_3: quantity of reheating steam flow through the condenser must be maintained at maximum under all operating conditions
Answer_4: condensate temperature must never be allowed to drop below  104Â°F

Question_Title: While trying to light off a burner on a semi-automated boiler, you note that the fuel oil solenoid valve at the burner will not stay open.  Which of the following  conditions could cause this problem?

Question_Title: A flue gas analysis is performed to determine the __________.
Answer_2: correct fuel/air ratio for efficient combustion

Question_Title: An advantage of steam atomization compared to mechanical atomization is __________.
Answer_2: improved heat transfer in the boiler
Answer_3: the ability of the system to maintain the proper ratio of fuel and air at all rates of combustion
Answer_4: bleed steam is utilized thereby increasing plant efficiency

Question_Title: Carryover in a marine boiler can be caused by __________.

Answer_4: overfiring the boiler to the end point of combustion

Question_Title: If contaminated lube oil were allowed to settle undisturbed in a tank, into which layers would the contaminants separate?

Answer_2: Sediment on the bottom, water in the middle, and oil on top.
Answer_3: Water on the bottom, oil in the middle, and sediment on top.
Answer_4: Water on the bottom, sediment in the middle, and oil on top.

Question_Title: In a huddling chamber type safety valve, initial valve opening is caused by static pressure acting on the __________.

Answer_3: estimate the BTU content of a quantity of fuel oil

Question_Title: Steam supplied to the main propulsion turbines is __________.

Answer_2: steam pressure acting on the increased surface area of the  projecting feather
Answer_3: steam flow passing through the calibrated adjusting ring
Answer_4: steam pressure acting on the exposed bottom area of the valve disk

Question_Title: During the routine inspection of an operating centrifugal  lube oil purifier, you notice oil discharging through the  water discharge port.  Which of the following actions should be taken?

Answer_3: Increase the bowl speed to balance the water and oil discharges.

Answer_4: the need to centrifuge the oil in addition to the use of the filter

Question_Title: A condensate recirculating line is provided to the main condenser in a closed feedwater system to __________.

Answer_3: assure a positive flow through the main feed pump

Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: Boilers equipped with steam atomizers can operate over a wide load range without cutting burners in and out because  __________.

Answer_4: steam velocity aids in the atomizing of fuel oil over a wide range of fuel pressures

Answer_3: The tank may overflow in the engine space causing unnecessary damage to all electrical equipment.

Answer_3: reduce the feedwater level set point

Question_Title: While on watch aboard a 900 psi steam vessel, you suddenly hear a loud, piercing, high-pitched noise.  Which  of the following actions should you take?

Answer_2: Rapidly move towards the direction of the noise to  investigate the probable source.
Answer_3: Cautiously move towards the source of the noise, sweeping the beam of your flash light ahead of you.
Answer_4: Move away from the noise to find a broom, then cautiously advance, sweeping the handle ahead of you to locate the source.

Question_Title: The terms 'swell' and 'shrink' relate to a change in boiler water level which __________.

Answer_4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question_Title: Which of the flue gas components listed contributes to the  greatest heat loss in a boiler?

Answer_3: automatically cleans the burner tips and eliminates fouling

Question_Title: The inability to maintain proper boiler water alkalinity, phosphate, or pH levels in a steam boiler, indicates a leak in the __________.

Question_Title: In comparison to a reaction turbine, a steam loss specific to an impulse turbine is known as __________.

Answer_3: the pressure used in the accumulation test

Question_Title: The term 'swell' relates to a change in boiler water level  which __________.

Answer_2: is due to the steam bubbles below the surface occupying a larger volume
Answer_3: is due to a rapid change of steam temperature during maneuvering operations
Answer_4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question_Title: Upon assuming the in port watch of a tank vessel while cargo operations are in progress, with the main engine and reduction gear secured you notice a substantial rise in the reduction gear lube oil sump level.  Which components or conditions should be checked immediately?

Answer_2: Confirm with the deck officer that there has been a change  in the vessel's trim.
Answer_3: Verify that there is no rotation of the propulsion  equipment.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: Slag caused by water in the fuel oil will  __________.

Question_Title: A high carbon monoxide content in the flue gases of a boiler indicates __________.

Answer_2: insure equal cooling of the main turbine bearings

Answer_1: remaining open until all pressure in the steam drum is relieved

Answer_3: opening gradually above a designated pressure
Answer_4: closing with a chattering motion to free scale deposits from the seats

Question_Title: Lube oil cannot be efficiently filtered if its __________.
Answer_3: pump discharge pressure is higher than the system pressure
Answer_4: pump capacity is greater than the system's needs

Question_Title: What will occur if the level of the atmospheric drain tank, (fresh water drain collector) is permitted to continuously  rise while the vessel is underway?

Answer_2: The pressure of the contaminated steam system will rise when the tank becomes full.

Answer_4: There will be an increase of vacuum in the main condensor within a short period of time.

Question_Title: Despite troubleshooting the system, the watch engineer has  been unable to transfer fuel to the settler while underway. As the settler level is becoming dangerously low, the engineer should now __________.
Answer_1: repeat all the steps he has taken

Answer_1: protect the system from high discharge pressure

Question_Title: A high percentage of carbon dioxide in boiler flue gases indicates __________.
Answer_4: nearly complete combustion of fuel oil

Answer_3: control the amount of arc during rotation of the soot blower element

Question_Title: For a period of time immediately after being secured, turbines should be rotated slowly to avoid __________.

Question_Title: A boiler accumulation test is used to measure the __________.
